metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14641 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description: A security flaw was found in the ip_frag_reasm() function in net/ipv4/ip_fragment.c in the Linux kernel from 4.19-rc1 to 4.19-rc3 inclusive, which can cause a later system crash in ip_do_fragment(). With certain non-default, but non-rare, configuration of a victim host, an attacker can trigger this crash remotely, thus leading to a remote denial-of-service.

notes.Note: sbeattie> this vulnerability is a result of the fix for CVE-2018-5391/FragmentSmack; however, an alternative fix for CVE-2018-5391 was to revert c2a936600f78aea00d3312ea4b66a79a4619f9b4, which is what the Ubuntu kernels used.

criterions.comment: linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
